p: When crystalline materials are analyzed, variations in the hit density on the detector often form a pattern that is specific to the crystalline structure and orientation of the specimen [ 7]. This pattern is due to the faceting of the specimen and associated trajectory aberrations [ 8, 9]. The appearance of such patterns is usually accompanied by crystallography-related information present within the reconstruted APT data, which can be retrieved and exploited to calibrate a tomographic reconstruction or extract meaningful microstructural information [ 1].
